Puma teams up with Spanish/Argentinian artist Felipe Pantone. Known for his colorful gradients, geometric shapes, patterns and grids, Pantone's work combines an analog upbringing with the ever-evolving digital future. 6596072734794.title: AIR JORDAN 6 RETRO (GS)
6596072734794.body_html:
As the Jordan model worn during the first Chicago Bulls championship season, the 6 already holds a special place in Jordan history. The dynamic design, which incorporated a sportscar spoiler inspired silhouette is something that would have kept the Jordan 6 near the top of all-time lists, no matter what happened on the court. 

The latest incarnation of the '91 classic outfits the sleek design in black nubuck, with 'electric' green accents that draws on the aggressive, futuristic aesthetic that has made the Oregon Ducks athletic program synonymous with cutting edge.  Reminiscent of an earlier Oregon players' edition, the electric green keeps the colors, but is sans-Ducks branding. 

If a size is not listed, it is sold out.

6596725702730.title: SUNGOD L/S TEE
6596725702730.body_html:
What began as a two-man design operation to create bootleg t-shirts for bands that lacked merch has, in time, grown into an LA creative collective, occasional small-run record label and graphic heavy streetwear brand. Born from the minds and talents of ex-Stussy Art Director, Adam Weissman and artist Noah Butkis, Real Bad Man maintains a focus on music, but have gone on to employ retro graphics, aged pop culture references and shady cartoonish characters for their own humorous and subversive brand of apocalyptic counter culture.

You might recognize this guy from the cover of On High Alert Volume 3, but this tee was designed before the cover.  We liked him so much we doubled up on him.  He's got some mystical pagan vibes going on.  

NOTE: the tees are running smaller than previous seasons, so we recommend you go up a size unless you like a tight t-shirt.

6596419354698.title: SHADOW 6000
6596419354698.body_html:
Saucony has over a century’s worth of experience making high performance running shoes. So, it’s no surprise that their shoes inspire the kind of loyalty that turns competitive runners into casual classics.

Even though state of the art technology is constantly evolving, the design process behind favorites like the Shadow 6000 keeps them at the forefront of comfort in the sportswear market. Along with its timeless, chunky tech-running silhouette, the Shadow 6000s never go out of style.

If a size is not listed, it is sold out.

S70441-8

6596593254474.title: ML2002RI
6596593254474.body_html:
Given the current revivalist fervor for all things millennial, you may think that that New Balance 2002 silhouette is named for its introductory year. But, as anyone who has ever worn a pair of New Balance knows, when you buy one of their runners, it’s not a trendy, seasonal thing; you are going to have that shoe until either you or the shoe can’t go anymore.

The 2002 model was actually introduced in 2010, as part of the 1000 series of running shoes. That makes the 2002 designation much more significant than what year it was, as a numerical leap forward meant a performance leap forward. Naturally, the 2002’s technical qualities made it one of the most coveted shoes of its era, one that is ripe for a timely reintroduction.  Thanks to a renewed appreciation for stylish tech, the 2002 returns as the 2002R, which outfits the retro styling with modernized performance tweaks.  

The latest 2002R offering opts for focused simplicity. A tonal colorway and suede/leather upper make for a look that can best be described as functional futurist. The modern technological features of stability web, ABZORB midsole, ABZORB SBS heel cushioning, and N-ergy outsole means that while the style is millennial chic, the performance is state of the art. 

If a size is not listed, it is sold out. 

ML2002RI

6595622535242.title: JAZZ DST REFLECTIVE
6595622535242.body_html:
The term Abstract Jazz, can't help but feel difficult and niche; until now, that is. That's because Saucony's version of abstract jazz has nothing to do with gathering in smoky clubs to listen to the sounds of a saxophone being thrown down the stairwell of a tall building. Instead, the venerable running shoe brand has reinterpreted its iconic Jazz silhouette, with experimental modernism firmly in mind. 

The Jazz DST updates the classic nylon/suede construction with hybrid, double eye and bungee lacing, a remodeled sole, and prominent branding. A reflective black colorway stylishly emphasizes these physical alterations. 

If a size is not listed, it is sold out.

6596190830666.title: FERTILIZER TEE
6596190830666.body_html:
Founder and skate filmmaker Ryan Garshell made the GX1000 name by documenting the hill-bombing exploits of what has been called “the most fearless crew in skateboarding.” The insane levels of physical risk, and an anti-authority, borderline anti-social attitude are a throwback to a time when skateboarding was anything but acceptable in mainstream culture, and you had to genuinely love it to even want to get involved with it in the first place. 

This attitude is reflected in GX1000’s back to basics output: irreverent, subcultural graphic design, applied to tees, hoodies, hats, accessories, and decks. If it sounds simple, that’s because it is. It’s meant for skating.

If a size is not listed, it is sold out. 

  • Midweight Tee
  • 100% Cotton

6590350655562.title: BLUE MOON CREW
6590350655562.body_html:
Visual artist Matt McCormick teams up with friend Jered Vargas for a line of Americana-themed apparel based around McCormick's paintings. By juxtaposing archetypal iconography commonly assoicated with the Old West against provocative seemingly disparate elements, McCormick and company provide a cynical social commentary on Hollywood, advertising and the constant misrepresentation of the American West.

With their latest capsule collection, One of These Days looks toward the fascinating history of ths song, "Blue Moon." 2021 is the 60th anniversary of "the track becoming an international #1 hit single. The Marcels released their classic doo-wop rendition of the standard ballad and brought the almost cartoon-like soda fountain culture of America to audiences around the world. The song, however, was first released back in 1934 and had already reached American acclaim in 1949 twice by Mel Torme and Billy Eckstine. 

"Blue Moon" resonates deeply with One of These Days for its fluidity across multiple genres and generations with its ability to be recontexualized by so many different artists. From Sam Cooke to Bob Dylan, the song perfectly encapsulates the timeless elements of American culture that One of These Days strives to speak to and represent.

To learn more about Matt McCormick, check out our interview HERE.

OOTD-BMH-1

6595621290058.title: ML2002RK
6595621290058.body_html:
Given the current revivalist fervor for all things millennial, you may think that that New Balance 2002 silhouette is named for its introductory year. But, as anyone who has ever worn a pair of New Balance knows, when you buy one of their runners, it’s not a trendy, seasonal thing; you are going to have that shoe until either you or the shoe can’t go anymore.

The 2002 model was actually introduced in 2010, as part of the 1000 series of running shoes. That makes the 2002 designation much more significant than what year it was, as a numerical leap forward meant a performance leap forward. Naturally, the 2002’s technical qualities made it one of the most coveted shoes of its era, one that is ripe for a timely reintroduction.  Thanks to a renewed appreciation for stylish tech, the 2002 returns as the 2002R, which outfits the retro styling with modernized performance tweaks.  

The latest 2002R offering opts for focused simplicity. A tonal colorway and all-suede upper make for a look that can best be described as functional futurist. The modern technological features of stability web, ABZORB midsole, ABZORB SBS heel cushioning, and N-ergy outsole means that while the style is millennial chic, the performance is state of the art. 

If a size is not listed, it is sold out.

6595621716042.title: OFFLINE 2.0
6595621716042.body_html:
Part of Nike's N.354 range, the Offline sandal offers an interpretation of the experimental spirit that's as philosophical as it is physical. While the saw-edged outsole, modular mule/sandal hybrid design, mesh/suede uppers, vented panels, and bungee cord fastening have a distinctly outdoor bent to them, the Offline is more about the idea of disconnecting and resetting than limit pushing. 

Really, the radical sentiment can be summed up by the footbed's text. ﻿It's okay to take a break.

6595528589386.title: x Old Pal Provisions FRUIT FANTASY
6595528589386.body_html:
In this society of increasingly legalized greenery, it's no surprise to see artisanal brands proudly making high-grade accessories to help complete the job. At Summerland Ceramics, their high quality "Stonerware" is created in small batches in the great state of California. 

Like they say, "Designed by the ritual of earth connection, our pieces are built from the earth itself. Sustainability, function and form are equivalent to us, and we do not settle for less." 

Don't completely understand, well take another toke, my friend. 

Offering Premium Ceramic pipes and bongs (remember when you couldn't say that word at the store or you'd be kicked out?), Summerland proudly stands by a simple principle: Made from Earth, By Hand, In California.

Take a bite out of bad vibes with our original ceramic apple pipe. Let this juicy lil' fruit sit stealthily on your bookcase disguised as an art object until your real friends come over...

  • 3"H X 3"W
  • Finished with a lead-free foodsafe glaze.
  • Made in California.

 ACC-SMRFF-GD

6595527114826.title: WOMEN'S SONORA OVERALL
6595527114826.body_html:
Carhartt made their name by providing work garments for heavy industry. We’re talking molten steel, chainsaws, railroad spikes, arc welders type of heavy industry. The rugged durability and simple, utilitarian aesthetic made Carhartt a hit beyond the world of hard hats and lunch pails.

In the 1980s, denim entrepreneur Edwin Faeh began importing and expanding Carhartt to Europe. Ultimately, in 1996, he struck a major deal to manufacture Carhartt branded clothing outside of the United States under the name Carhartt 'Work In Progress'. The W.I.P. label takes the traditional Carhartt approach to construction and form, and applies it to a range of fashion-oriented garments and accessories, incorporating European-inspired designs with long-standing, renowned styles. Although the tailoring may have downtown in mind, the quality remains pure job site.

The Women's Sonora Overall takes inspiration from utilitarian garments originally crafted for manual work, but is executed in a contemporary, refined cut. Constructed here from our 100% organic 'dodge' color denim, which has been worn-washed. Features chest pockets and a double layer at the knee.

6595539107914.title: PURPLES CAMO BANDANA
6595539107914.body_html:
The brainchild of designer Hardy Blechman, Maharishi has produced its award-winning pacifist military designs since 1994.  The roots of Maharishi, and offshoot label MHI, lay in Blechman’s former career in the military surplus clothing trade, which inspired Blechman to take the concept of repurposing to a new level.

An extremely rare disruptive pattern worn by paratroopers of the Army of the Republic of Vietnam and then adopted by some of the U.S. advisors to the ARVN. Their own U.S. uniforms were re-made in the Vietnamese pattern in local factories or tailor shops - in part because this helped show some solidarity with the ARVN, and in part because of the popularity of the pattern itself during the 1960s.

6595527802954.title: L/S MARBLE SHIRT
6595527802954.body_html:
Carhartt made their name by providing work garments for heavy industry. We’re talking molten steel, chainsaws, railroad spikes, arc welders type of heavy industry. The rugged durability and simple, utilitarian aesthetic made Carhartt a hit beyond the world of hard hats and lunch pails.

In the 1980s, denim entrepreneur Edwin Faeh began importing and expanding Carhartt to Europe. Ultimately, in 1996, he struck a major deal to manufacture Carhartt branded clothing outside of the United States under the name Carhartt 'Work In Progress'. The W.I.P. label takes the traditional Carhartt approach to construction and form, and applies it to a range of fashion-oriented garments and accessories, incorporating European-inspired designs with long-standing, renowned styles. Although the tailoring may have downtown in mind, the quality remains pure job site.

The Marble Shirt is a classic work shirt constructed from our cotton 'moraga' twill fabric, with a distinct marble-like pattern. The garment features two chest pockets and a curved hem. Accented with woven Carhartt WIP label. Loose fit.

If a size is not listed, it is sold out.

  • loose fit
  • two chest pockets
  • square label
  • WIP script label

6595527180362.title: PLEASURE POINT 10"
6595527180362.body_html:
In this society of increasingly legalized greenery, it's no surprise to see artisanal brands proudly making high-grade accessories to help complete the job. At Summerland Ceramics, their high quality "Stonerware" is created in small batches in the great state of California. 

Like they say, "Designed by the ritual of earth connection, our pieces are built from the earth itself. Sustainability, function and form are equivalent to us, and we do not settle for less." 

Don't completely understand, well take another toke, my friend. 

Offering Premium Ceramic pipes and bongs (remember when you couldn't say that word at the store or you'd be kicked out?), Summerland proudly stands by a simple principle: Made from Earth, By Hand, In California.

Pleasure Point is a place known to sun-seekers the world over as a quiet spot to soak, surf and lose some tanlines. If you like getting lost, you're going to love Pleasure Point.

  •  10"H x 4.5"W
  • Lead-free, food-safe glaze and ceramic

6595527245898.title: SR GALAXY HAT
6595527245898.body_html:
The thing about rats is, they’re everywhere and they’re nowhere. They’re everywhere in the sense that any concentration of humans collected anywhere on the planet coexist with our underworld rodent friends. They’re nowhere, in the sense that most people prefer not to see rats. Every so often, crossing paths with one might be unavoidable, but very few people go out actively seeking rats. It takes a specific kind of person to sympathize with and support something that a majority of the world has declared to be repugnant.

This is exactly the kind of mentality that informs Stray Rats. From the Miami based brand’s earliest days, Stray Rats have never produced anything that the founders wouldn’t personally wear. Stray Rats draws inspirations from the things they love, and distills them down into the kind of pithy reference that only a genuine, lifelong affection for something could provide. You either get it or you don’t.

  • Snapback

The brainchild of designer Hardy Blechman, Maharishi has produced its award-winning pacifist military designs since 1994.  The roots of Maharishi, and offshoot label MHI, lay in Blechman’s former career in the military surplus clothing trade, which inspired Blechman to take the concept of repurposing to a new level.

This jacket features patches from several U.S. Navy Riverine units of the Vietnam War era and many more from Hardy Blechman’s travels, experiences and from collaborators including Hyperdub, Myoshka, Kay One, Teach, Todd James, OJAS, Gasr, Andy Warhol and XL Recordings, the label of artist Everything Is Recorded, who provided the soundtrack Music for Maharishi, as well as rare 60s anti-war patches.

6589873782858.title: x LDRS FORUM
6589873782858.body_html:
When adidas first released the Forum in 1984, it became the first silhouette from the Three Stripes to break the $100 price point. With innovative new features like the "criss-cross system" and "Dellinger's Web," the basketball shoe was built for comfort and stability. And while the shoe was undoubtedly conceived for the courts, the style would also become a cornerstone of streetwear and hip hop culture.

Coming up on 40 years since its release, the Forum has seen a recent resurgence in popularity with the OG colorway seeing a re-release, along with a handful of notable new iterations from IVY PARK, Bad Bunny, and well, us. While the shoe's original pricetag has remained remarkably stagnant, the new styles are anything but trapped in time. 

For the latest in Forum collaboration, adidas teams up with Chicago sneaker store LDRS for a cream colored Mid with gold foil branding, red accents on the outsole, and all of the features that made the Forum unique from the start.

If a size is not listed, it is sold out.

FW8768

1298163171402.body_html:
If you can’t come to the register, Bodega brings the register to you. Shopping online is no reason to miss out on the always popular impulse items. We couldn’t swing the tree shaped air fresheners or best of 80s power ballads cassette tapes, but at least you'll be prepared to add a little extra heat to summer, as needed.

6592288391242.title: ML2002RL
6592288391242.body_html:
Given the current revivalist fervor for all things millennial, you may think that that New Balance 2002 silhouette is named for its introductory year. But, as anyone who has ever worn a pair of New Balance knows, when you buy one of their runners, it’s not a trendy, seasonal thing; you are going to have that shoe until either you or the shoe can’t go anymore.

The 2002 model was actually introduced in 2010, as part of the 1000 series of running shoes. That makes the 2002 designation much more significant than what year it was, as a numerical leap forward meant a performance leap forward. Naturally, the 2002’s technical qualities made it one of the most coveted shoes of its era, one that is ripe for a timely reintroduction.  Thanks to a renewed appreciation for stylish tech, the 2002 returns as the 2002R, which outfits the retro styling with modernized performance tweaks.  

The latest 2002R offering opts for focused simplicity. A tonal colorway and all-suede upper make for a look that can best be described as functional futurist. The modern technological features of stability web, ABZORB midsole, ABZORB SBS heel cushioning, and N-ergy outsole means that while the style is millennial chic, the performance is state of the art. 

If a size is not listed, it is sold out. 

ML2002RL 

This product is considered a Quickstrike (QS). All QS, limited edition, and brand collaboration products are final sale.

6592288227402.title: YEEZY BOOST 380
6592288227402.body_html:
The latest silhouette in the Yeezy line takes a minimalist approach to the signature Primeknit construction. A modified, slightly higher, ankle bootie cut, with layered Primeknit creates a textured effect, with an extended midsole construction offering a fashion forward take on the popular chunky look. 

The Yeezy Boost 380 Alien Blue RF features an upper composed of reflective, multi-toned re-engineered Primeknit in a sock-like construction, providing a snug yet adaptable fit. The translucent monofilament window is woven into the upper, adding visual interest and breathability. This model features no-tie stretch laces for easy on and off wear, and comes equipped with a second set of standard laces. A reengineered full-length Boost midsole elevates the cushioning experience, offering optimal comfort. The herringbone rubber outsole offers unique design cues and improved traction. 

If a size is not listed, it is sold out. 

GW0304

This product is considered a Quickstrike (QS). All QS, limited edition, and brand collaboration products are final sale.

6590323458122.title: x KidSuper SUEDE VTG
6590323458122.body_html:
Brooklyn art collective KidSuper and Puma kick off the second go-round of their collaborative relationship with a mix and match take on the all-time classic Suede Vintage silhouette. 

A grey suede upper is offset by contrasting Form Stripe, toe cap and heel counter, with hints of visible contrast stitching adding additional, subtle color pops. A gum sole brings an indoor court touch to this street icon, while KidSuper text at the medial side and two loops at the lateral side give off an experimental, art in progress vibe. 

38051301

This product is considered a Quickstrike (QS). All QS, limited edition, and brand collaboration products are final sale.

6590323327050.title: x CLOT 1461
6590323327050.body_html:
2020 marked the 60th anniversary of Dr. Martens’ 1460 boot. This icon of subcultural fashion was celebrated with a series of collaborative releases throughout the year. A year after the 1460 debuted, Dr. Martens introduced the 1461, which brought the durability, quality, and style that Doc Martens already had become known for, to a low-cut, three eyelet shoe. The 1461 quickly became a fashion staple in its own right, and has stood beside the 1460 as an icon ever since.

For 2021, the collaborative, celebration concept is applied to the 1461. Influential Hong Kong imprint CLOT deftly apply their trademark East meets West outlook to the 1461, with a design that is equal parts subtle and impactful. The classic, smooth black leather construction features red contrast stitching, and a bright red take on the signature air cushioned Dr. Martens sole. The traditional Chinese influenced design is completed with a custom printed sockliner featuring CLOT's silk inspired pattern. 

27153001

This product is considered a Quickstrike (QS). All QS, limited edition, and brand collaboration products are final sale.

6569699967050.title: UC1A4R04 RING
6569699967050.body_html:
Jun Takahashi’s Undercover label is a genuine pioneer in the world of fashion. Combining his youthful love of the Sex Pistols with an avant-garde, elegant, high fashion sensibility, Takahashi’s original designs redefined the boundaries between runway and street.

Undercover has expanded upon Takahashi’s punk-influenced beginnings and become one of the most revered and influential brands on the planet. 

  • Buffalo horn
  • Silver 925
  • Made in Japan

6592819757130.title: NATTO SUNGLASSES
6592819757130.body_html:
As a creative collective, Brain Dead is not based on one single person, nor one single idea. With its disruptive, graphic-led approach, the brand takes its cues from post punk, underground comics, skateboarding, and the spirit of subculture as a whole. With such an open design path, the brand is able to churn out innovative pieces, time and time again.

Brain Dead offers a study in contrasts for Spring/Summer '21, as the altered perception of their otherworldly creative sensibilities collide with everyday functionality. Which is to say, utilitarian staples, with a twist, and at times much more than twist, of the unexpected. Brain Dead brings a whole new meaning to functioning on a higher plane.   

﻿Natto handmade cellulose acetate frames (acetate is made from cotton & wood, is eco friendly, sustainably sourced & bio-degradable). Stainless steel cores for strength and flexibility. Extra sturdy and durable zinc-free barrel hinges. Optical-quality nylon lenses with 100% UV protection. Custom Brain Dead case and cloth included. Post Modern Primitive Eye Protection ™

The thing about rats is, they’re everywhere and they’re nowhere. They’re everywhere in the sense that any concentration of humans collected anywhere on the planet coexist with our underworld rodent friends. They’re nowhere, in the sense that most people prefer not to see rats. Every so often, crossing paths with one might be unavoidable, but very few people go out actively seeking rats. It takes a specific kind of person to sympathize with and support something that a majority of the world has declared to be repugnant.

This is exactly the kind of mentality that informs Stray Rats. From the Miami based brand’s earliest days, Stray Rats have never produced anything that the founders wouldn’t personally wear. Stray Rats draws inspirations from the things they love, and distills them down into the kind of pithy reference that only a genuine, lifelong affection for something could provide. You either get it or you don’t.

If a size is not listed, it is sold out.

  • Graphic Print
  • Ribbed Collar
  • Made in USA.

6582620127306.title: GHOST BLC1
6582620127306.body_html:
South Korean eyewear brand Gentle Monster was established in 2011 based on the philosophy of high-end experimentation. Focusing on product, space, styling, campaign, and service, Gentle Monster aims to offer a radically new and innovative point of view for design. These principles are addressed not only in the design of their sunglasses, but also in the design of their retail spaces and creative projects. Their refusal to be recognized as simply an eyewear brand is spoken in every frame, product, and store.

Gentle Monster's GHOST BLC1 is a look into the brand's prowess with contemporary design. The sunglasses feature a clear blue hexagonal acetate frame with icey silver lenses to match. Stylish, bold, and most importantly — very cool. 

•    Unique hexagonal frame
•    Silver mirrored lenses
•    Updated metal core design
•    Frame Front: 143.5mm, Frame Side: 147mm
•    Lens Width: 53.5mm, Lens Height: 35.3mm
•    Manufacturer: Jingwei Optical (Huizhou) Co.,Ltd.
•    Country of Manufacturer: China

6592750420042.title: XZ 0006 INSIDE OUT
6592750420042.body_html:
Back in 2008, adidas debuted the original A-ZX series. The project pushed the boundaries of what the evolving field of special release product could achieve, with a comprehensive trip through the legendary range of ZX running shoes that paired a collaborative partner with the corresponding letter of the alphabet. (Incidentally, the ‘B’ in the original A-ZX was represented by a fondly remembered Bodega ZX 8000.)

A-ZX makes a triumphant return, with another deep dive into the ZX archive. This time around, instead of collaborative partners, each letter of the alphabet represents a different, conceptual tribute to the high tech running footwear that represented the era’s pinnacle of athletic performance.

'X' is for X-Ray. A project the scope of A-ZX requires an inside and out knowledge of the legendary range. The X-Ray is a literal expression of the inside and out concept. With the inner and outer construction flipped, and the presence of translucent overlays, the design gives the unique impression of being able to view the inner workings of the ZX classics. 

If a size is not listed, it is sold out. 

GZ2709

6592358875210.title: UNIVERSITY SWEAT
6592358875210.body_html:
Carhartt made their name by providing work garments for heavy industry. We’re talking molten steel, chainsaws, railroad spikes, arc welders type of heavy industry. The rugged durability and simple, utilitarian aesthetic made Carhartt a hit beyond the world of hard hats and lunch pails.

In the 1980s, denim entrepreneur Edwin Faeh began importing and expanding Carhartt to Europe. Ultimately, in 1996, he struck a major deal to manufacture Carhartt branded clothing outside of the United States under the name Carhartt 'Work In Progress'. The W.I.P. label takes the traditional Carhartt approach to construction and form, and applies it to a range of fashion-oriented garments and accessories, incorporating European-inspired designs with long-standing, renowned styles. Although the tailoring may have downtown in mind, the quality remains pure job site.

The University Sweat is made from unbrushed, 9.4 oz cotton. The item has been garment washed, for increased comfort and a more complex color configuration. Features a graphic Carhartt script print across the front.

  • 100% Cotton Sweat, 9.4 oz
  • regular fit
  • unbrushed
  • garment washed
  • graphic print
I028957-08L

6590993563722.title: AIR JORDAN 1 MID
6590993563722.body_html:
What is there to say about the Jordan that started it all? Revolutionary? Icon? Legend? They've all been said, but they're all true. 

Even with the 6 NBA titles, countless individual awards, and greatest of all time status still to come, the moment Michael Jordan stepped onto an NBA court wearing Jordan 1s for the first time, everything changed. The violation of the NBA uniform code and "banned" status only made them more cool in the eyes of the public.

It's certainly not classic Chicago, but the 'Purple Pulse' Jordan 1 is undeniably colorful. The deftly combined pastel tones are an ideal, summer ready expression of the Joran 1's colorful legacy.

6590322376778.title: x Casablanca MS327CAA
6590322376778.body_html:
The championship doubles pairing that is New Balance and Casablanca have been running their proverbial opponents ragged, all over the court with a series of collaborative releases combining a sporty elegance inspired by Casablanca head Charaf Tajer's love of tennis, with the sleek, retro running heritage of the 327 and 237 silhouettes. 

Like the 327, the 237 is a revamped take on ‘70s running style, featuring a wedge shaped silhouette and foam midsole cushioning. The key differences come in the form of the overlay, outsole, and ‘N’ branding. On the 237, the overlays offer a more subdued, familiar appearance, while the wraparound treads of the 327 are traded for a subtler, herringbone design that extends just past the heel. The 237 retains the same outsize ‘N’ branding as the 327, but applies it to both the lateral and medial sides.

New Balance and Casablanca have served up two more perfectly placed shots. The tennis club chic of premium quality, perorated white leather uppers is paired with Casablanca's signature jacquard pattern, offered in a new, deep red and dark green colorway that elegantly hints at perfectly maintained grass and clay courts. 

If a size is not listed, it is sold out. 

MS327CAA

This product is considered a Quickstrike (QS). All QS, limited edition, and brand collaboration products are final sale.

6592203423818.title: BUCKETS BALL MARKER
6592203423818.body_html:
What happens when the founder of a legendary underground magazine grows older, wiser, and picks up an old new hobby from his childhood? The answer is, of course, Malbon Golf. Created by Stephen Malbon, who founded Frank151 in Atlanta in the 1990s, and his wife Erica, the Los Angeles brand is the collision of streetwear and the fairway.

The brand's mission is to introduce young people to the sport and give cool, seasoned golfers something more fashionable than your typical, stale, boxy golfing apparel. With folks like Travis Scott and Schoolboy Q as fans of the brand, it seems like Malbon Golf's got a winning formula, something like Titleist for people cool, intelligent, and beautiful enough to find themselves shopping at a place like Bodega.

With folks like Travis Scott and Schoolboy Q as fans of the brand, it seems like Malbon Golf's got a winning formula, something like Titleist for people cool, intelligent, and beautiful enough to find themselves shopping at a place like Bodega.

6592205815882.title: INVADER CREWNECK
6592205815882.body_html:
The thing about rats is, they’re everywhere and they’re nowhere. They’re everywhere in the sense that any concentration of humans collected anywhere on the planet coexist with our underworld rodent friends. They’re nowhere, in the sense that most people prefer not to see rats. Every so often, crossing paths with one might be unavoidable, but very few people go out actively seeking rats. It takes a specific kind of person to sympathize with and support something that a majority of the world has declared to be repugnant.

This is exactly the kind of mentality that informs Stray Rats. From the Miami based brand’s earliest days, Stray Rats have never produced anything that the founders wouldn’t personally wear. Stray Rats draws inspirations from the things they love, and distills them down into the kind of pithy reference that only a genuine, lifelong affection for something could provide. You either get it or you don’t.

If a size is not listed, it is sold out.

6592205291594.title: P38 LINEN PANTS
6592205291594.body_html:
In the contextual vacuum of contemporary, internet driven fashion culture, words can be stripped of all their meaning in an instant, depending on who wields them. Anything and everything is up for grabs as an aesthetic.

Something like vintage Americana is more than a vague sensibility. There are certain expectations, based in decades of tradition that come with the real deal, genuine article. Los Angeles based Dr. Collectors know this better than most. Founded in 2010 by Olivier, Beatrice and Teddy Grasset, Dr. Collectors is the culmination of years’ worth of collecting, selling, designing and reconstructing vintage denim and Americana.

Light years beyond some faded washes or artfully placed tears, the traditional manufacturing techniques, fabrics, tools, all the way down to the indigo hand-dyeing of denim, utilized by Dr. Collectors embody the heart and soul of what makes vintage appealing. These are clothes that are meant to last.

If a size is not listed, it is sold out.

  • 100% Linen 
  • Pigment Dye
  • Elastic Waist

6591566905418.title: HOODED RUNNER SWEAT
6591566905418.body_html:
Carhartt made their name by providing work garments for heavy industry. We’re talking molten steel, chainsaws, railroad spikes, arc welders type of heavy industry. The rugged durability and simple, utilitarian aesthetic made Carhartt a hit beyond the world of hard hats and lunch pails.

In the 1980s, denim entrepreneur Edwin Faeh began importing and expanding Carhartt to Europe. Ultimately, in 1996, he struck a major deal to manufacture Carhartt branded clothing outside of the United States under the name Carhartt 'Work In Progress'. The W.I.P. label takes the traditional Carhartt approach to construction and form, and applies it to a range of fashion-oriented garments and accessories, incorporating European-inspired designs with long-standing, renowned styles. Although the tailoring may have downtown in mind, the quality remains pure job site.

If a size is not listed, it is sold out.

6591741067338.body_html:
Factory work boots and a cushioned sole developed by a medical doctor recuperating from a broken foot seem like an incredibly unlikely starting point for footwear that would become a staple of cutting edge youth culture. But why would a shoe synonymous with individualistic style have a story about doing things the usual way?

After their adoption by the original ska and reggae loving skinheads in 1960s England unlocked the fashion potential of these humble work boots, the genie was well and truly out of the bottle. The genre hopping history of Doc Martens has taken the iconic bouncing soles from Slade to the Specials to Sham 69 to Specimen to the Smiths to Skinny Puppy to Soundgarden, and that’s just the ‘S’ section. It doesn’t really matter what your preferred brand of noise is, the timeless style and unshakable durability of Doc Martens are forever in style.

The classic 1461 oxford silhouette in Milled Nubuck offers a soft, broken-in look and feel from the get-go. 

If a size is not listed, it is sold out. 

  • Dr. Martens 1461 
  • Water-resistant Milled Nubuck WP upper 
  • BEN sole 
  • Yellow stitching

6590322933834.title: x Pleasures SUPERSTAR
6590322933834.body_html:
Over the past half century, the adidas Superstar has taken on a multitude of forms ranging from the classic and familiar, to one-off special editions. As part of the shelltoed icon's 50th anniversary celebrations, alternative subculture veterans Pleasures pay their own inimitable form of tribute to a fondly remembered, limited edition Superstar. 

In 2006, as part of a wide ranging celebration of the adicolor range, adidas released a classic white Superstar with a unique feature, clear three stripe branding designed to house interchangeable plastic inserts, allowing for customized color combinations. 

Pleasures recreate this concept, with a black upper, red Pleasures branding, and interchangeable stripes featuring wild colors and patterns, providing a more alternative suited interpretation. 

GY5691

This product is considered a Quickstrike (QS). All QS, limited edition, and brand collaboration products are final sale.

6590331224138.title: x MMW 3-IN-1 CONVERTIBLE TROUSERS
6590331224138.body_html:
The avant garde conceptualism meets technical high-performance philosophy of Alyx founder Matthew M. Williams is brought to a new collaborative collection of Nike sportswear for Spring/Summer ’21.

A new range of athletic apparel states its utilitarian intentions with a blacked out color palette featuring the prominent application of the Japanese kanji characters 鍛錬[tanren] meaning training. Modular, 3-in-1 silhouettes abound throughout the collection, while functional design details like anatomical seams and breathable mesh are applied to even the simplest pieces on offer.

﻿Matthew M. Williams delivers conceptual and functional fashion with the Nike x MMW Pants. A 3-in-1 design uses water-resistant pants, convertible shorts and an internal short, letting you adapt to most weather conditions throughout the year. They're the next step in training, designed for sport, culture and spirit.

6591623331914.title: JUMPSUIT
6591623331914.body_html:
Aesthetic ideals like liberating the way we dress and expressing individuality in a creative way are standard fare in fashion mission statements, but they don't always have the weight of someone like Issey Miyake behind them. When people say that he reinvented the pleat, they aren't exaggerating. Issey Miyake literally reinvented the methodology of creating pleated garments.

No surprise then, that the Homme Plissé in Homme Plissé Issey Miyake is French for pleated man. With the renowned designer's idea that "design is not for philosop hy; it's for life" as a guiding principle, the Homme Plissé imprint applies a technologically forward thinking approach to essential menswear fixtures, imbibing fine arts levels of elegance with a modern, functional edge. 

This pleated short sleeve jumpsuit has a straight shape and cropped, ankle length hem. It features a shirt collar with a single button and a concealed dual zip closure on its front. It includes two chest pockets and two side pockets.

6591623430218.title: NEW ARC HOODED SWEATSHIRT
6591623430218.body_html:
Since Seoul based streetwear label thisisneverthat have experienced an explosion in popularity concurrent with the rise of K-Pop, it’s fairly common to see the two linked whenever thisisneverthat is being introduced to a new audience. While showing up in a BTS video only accelerated the thisisneverthat’s turbo boosted high profile status, the connection between the two goes beyond simple name-dropping.

What K-Pop does in taking a deceptively simple starting point, pop music, and executing it to almost superhuman levels of perfection, thisisneverthat does with the extremely generalized category of streetwear. Recognizable, but varied enough to keep people interested text branding, innovative takes on perennial favorites and a dedication to functionality make thisisneverthat a label that can imbue timeless style with a modern edge.

6591622283338.title: CYCLING JERSEY
6591622283338.body_html:
As a creative collective, Brain Dead is not based on one single person, nor one single idea. With its disruptive, graphic-led approach, the brand takes its cues from post punk, underground comics, skateboarding, and the spirit of subculture as a whole. With such an open design path, the brand is able to churn out innovative pieces, time and time again.

Brain Dead offers a study in contrasts for Spring/Summer '21, as the altered perception of their otherworldly creative sensibilities collide with everyday functionality. 6591623364682.title: WOMEN'S CYCLE SHORT
6591623364682.body_html:
As a creative collective, Brain Dead is not based on one single person, nor one single idea. With its disruptive, graphic-led approach, the brand takes its cues from post punk, underground comics, skateboarding, and the spirit of subculture as a whole. With such an open design path, the brand is able to churn out innovative pieces, time and time again.

Brain Dead offers a study in contrasts for Spring/Summer '21, as the altered perception of their otherworldly creative sensibilities collide with everyday functionality. Which is to say, utilitarian staples, with a twist, and at times much more than twist, of the unexpected. Brain Dead brings a whole new meaning to functioning on a higher plane.

6591566970954.title: S/S TEST T-SHIRT
6591566970954.body_html:
Carhartt made their name by providing work garments for heavy industry. We’re talking molten steel, chainsaws, railroad spikes, arc welders type of heavy industry. The rugged durability and simple, utilitarian aesthetic made Carhartt a hit beyond the world of hard hats and lunch pails.

In the 1980s, denim entrepreneur Edwin Faeh began importing and expanding Carhartt to Europe. Ultimately, in 1996, he struck a major deal to manufacture Carhartt branded clothing outside of the United States under the name Carhartt 'Work In Progress'. The W.I.P. label takes the traditional Carhartt approach to construction and form, and applies it to a range of fashion-oriented garments and accessories, incorporating European-inspired designs with long-standing, renowned styles. Although the tailoring may have downtown in mind, the quality remains pure job site.

6585708838986.title: NOCTA NRG AU ESS GPX SS TOP 2
6585708838986.body_html:
From their inception, whether innovating revolutionary performance technology or redefining its aesthetic parameters, Nike have been on the cutting edge of this style. In this spirit of always leading and never following, Nike introduce the new, NOCTA collection.

No matter where in the world you travel to, sportswear is a common denominator. You’ll find it everywhere from out of the way back streets, only traversed by locals, to the chicest (and priciest) shopping district fashion centers. It is nothing short of the universal currency of modern style.

With form-fitting style inspired by sport performance and a the timeless adaptability that transformed athletic wear into essential, street level fashion, NOCTA is multi-functional style for the constant motion of an on-the-go lifestyle.

The Cardinal Stock collection offers up the essential silhouettes of NOCTA, in a variety of new colors. 

﻿Add to your essentials with a premium tee featuring Swoosh branding and NOCTA wordmarks.

If a size is not listed, it is sold out. 

  • Nike Nota Cardinal Stock Tee 
  • Blue Void/White
  • DJ5951-492

6590952669258.title: HYDRO MOC
6590952669258.body_html:
Outdoors enthusiasts are already well-acquainted with the Merrell brand and their ongoing commitment to quality footwear  Entering their 40th year as one of the most trusted names both on and off the trail, Merrell now introduces a new line of products under the 1TRL moniker.

By embracing the brand's pioneering spirit and employing the latest technological and eco-friendly advances in footwear, Merrell's 1TRL line dips into its own archives for inspiration, ultimately creating new designs with updated materials like Kinetic Fit, FLEX Connect and Quantum Grip, Gore-Tex, Cordura and Vibram. As Merrell puts it, these designs are "for those searching for another dimension of the trail.

The Hydro Moc is an amphibious model in the aftersport category, designed for the trails that take you in and out of water. Formed from a single-density injected EVA contoured arch with an articulated heel and strap for advanced support. It’s not for everyone, but it might just be for you.

If a size is not listed, it is sold out. 


• Single-density injected EVA
• Contoured arch for support
• Articulated heel with strap for secure fit
• 2mm lug depth

6590952538186.title: SKID GRIP HI (Beat the World)
6590952538186.body_html:
Sure, Converse is a global style icon, but it's not exactly reaching to say that the iconic One Star brand can trace everything back to the basketball court. The new 'Beat the World' pack, featuring the evergreen Chuck 70 and the 111 year old (!!) Skidgrip silhouette, does just that, with a bold, all-over patterned design. 

The pattern is a collage constructed from historical print advertisements, graphic designs, and even yearbook photos, for a unique, practical demonstration of Converse's basketball legacy.

6590894735434.title: WOMEN'S AIR MAX 90
6590894735434.body_html:
Following up an icon is difficult enough. Following up on a shoe that became an icon for completely revolutionizing footwear design almost reaches the labors of Hercules level. Which is to say that it is so difficult, that it almost seems designed to fail. This is the psychic hole that the Air Max 90 had to dig its way out of, from the moment it was conceived of as an idea..

As the first Air Max of a brand new decade, the Air Max 90 reflected the rapid but seismic shifts in the landscape that occurred between the release of the first and second Air Max models. Although the appetite for ‘extreme’ aesthetics was still just around the next corner, by 1990 tastes in sportswear had embraced comprehensively bolder looks.

The Air Max 90 responded by increasing the volume contained in the Air units, and the size of the visible Air window to go along with it. A busier look, featuring TPU ribbing, and paneled overlays took a more aggressive stance than its predecessor, as did a plethora of vivid colorways.

With soft pink suede laid over a classic white mesh base, and deep red accents throughout, this Air Max 90 keeps love in the air, all year round. 

If a size is not listed, it is sold out. 

  • Nike Air Max 90 
  • White/University Red/Tulip Pink/White
  • DD8029-100

6590893883466.title: AIR JORDAN 1 MID
6590893883466.body_html:
What is there to say about the Jordan that started it all? Revolutionary? Icon? Legend? They've all been said, but they're all true. 

Even with the 6 NBA titles, countless individual awards, and greatest of all time status still to come, the moment Michael Jordan stepped onto an NBA court wearing Jordan 1s for the first time, everything changed. The violation of the NBA uniform code and "banned" status only made them more cool in the eyes of the public. 

A new Jordan 1 Mid colorway brings a sense of novelty to the familiar, by changing up the application of the classic Chicago red/white/black colors.

6590411604042.title: AIR MAX PRE-DAY
6590411604042.body_html:
Nike break new ground by reimagining the past. Instead of fixed points on a wall chart, the history of innovation that has defined Nike is viewed as a fluid continuum, that can be manipulated at will. The end result of this process is the 1970s influenced Air Max Pre-Day.

The nylon mesh and suede overlay construction sported by so many ‘70s classics is replicated and modernized with a 100% recycled material upper, and synthetic suede overlay design. The foam midsole that revolutionized running shoe cushioning is maintained in the Air Max Pre-Day’s forefoot, while a large volume Visible Air heel unit organically incorporates a strikingly modern structure into the classic influences. Just as the developments of the ‘70s prefigured the future search for maximized cushioning and minimized weight, the Air Max Pre-Day’s use of sustainable materials sets down the markers for the future of footwear design.

If a size is not listed, it is sold out.

6590893031498.title: ORIGAMI RAYON SHIRT
6590893031498.body_html:
Returning World War II and Korean War veterans turned outlaw bikers, 1960s anti-war counterculture, the guerrilla chic of bands like The Clash, the cold war paranoia fueled paramilitary leanings of ‘80s industrial music, the militancy of politicized ‘90s hip hop…the military aesthetic has a long, storied and ever evolving history as a subcultural statement. Thanks to these diverse associations, it also has a permanent place in streetwear.

Liberaiders represent another evolution in the military aesthetic. In an age when authenticity of experience and output are everything, simply slapping some camouflage patterns on a basic blank doesn’t cut it. Liberaiders are informed by the original spirit behind the re-appropriation of military surplus, but dedicated to the highest quality that contemporary fashion and modern technology has to offer.

6590866587722.title: SS HINTERLAND SHIRT
6590866587722.body_html:
Carhartt made their name by providing work garments for heavy industry. We’re talking molten steel, chainsaws, railroad spikes, arc welders type of heavy industry. The rugged durability and simple, utilitarian aesthetic made Carhartt a hit beyond the world of hard hats and lunch pails.

In the 1980s, denim entrepreneur Edwin Faeh began importing and expanding Carhartt to Europe. Ultimately, in 1996, he struck a major deal to manufacture Carhartt branded clothing outside of the United States under the name Carhartt 'Work In Progress'. The W.I.P. label takes the traditional Carhartt approach to construction and form, and applies it to a range of fashion-oriented garments and accessories, incorporating European-inspired designs with long-standing, renowned styles. Although the tailoring may have downtown in mind, the quality remains pure job site.

The Hinterland Short Sleeve Shirt is a button down shirt constructed from a lightweight cotton blend sateen. The item has been garment washed and features an allover seasonal print. Loose fit.

6590448435274.title: DRC BAG 20 OZ NATURAL INDIGO
6590448435274.body_html:
In the contextual vacuum of contemporary, internet driven fashion culture, words can be stripped of all their meaning in an instant, depending on who wields them. Anything and everything is up for grabs as an aesthetic.

Something like vintage Americana is more than a vague sensibility. There are certain expectations, based in decades of tradition that come with the real deal, genuine article. Los Angeles based Dr. Collectors know this better than most. Founded in 2010 by Olivier, Beatrice and Teddy Grasset, Dr. Collectors is the culmination of years’ worth of collecting, selling, designing and reconstructing vintage denim and Americana.

Light years beyond some faded washes or artfully placed tears, the traditional manufacturing techniques, fabrics, tools, all the way down to the indigo hand-dyeing of denim, utilized by Dr. Collectors embody the heart and soul of what makes vintage appealing. These are clothes that are meant to last.

DC-SS21-09

6590282367050.title: x Human Made SLIP ON PURE HM
6590282367050.body_html:
After reimagining an array of archival three stripes classics, Human Made turns the philosophy of the future is in the past to a never-before-seen footwear silhouette, which draws on traditional influences.

The adidas x Human Made Slipon Pure HM features mesh upper construction, embellished by embroidered Human Made heart logo graphics. The low-cut simplicity is inspired by traditional Kung-Fu footwear, while full-length Boost cushioning adds a contemporary performance twist to the timeless source material.

Thanks to these diverse associations, it also has a permanent place in streetwear.

Liberaiders represent another evolution in the military aesthetic. In an age when authenticity of experience and output are everything, simply slapping some camouflage patterns on a basic blank doesn’t cut it. Liberaiders are informed by the original spirit behind the re-appropriation of military surplus, but dedicated to the highest quality that contemporary fashion and modern technology has to offer.

6590350753866.title: P38 BEACH STRIPE
6590350753866.body_html:
In the contextual vacuum of contemporary, internet driven fashion culture, words can be stripped of all their meaning in an instant, depending on who wields them. Anything and everything is up for grabs as an aesthetic.

Something like vintage Americana is more than a vague sensibility. There are certain expectations, based in decades of tradition that come with the real deal, genuine article. Los Angeles based Dr. Collectors know this better than most. Founded in 2010 by Olivier, Beatrice and Teddy Grasset, Dr. Collectors is the culmination of years’ worth of collecting, selling, designing and reconstructing vintage denim and Americana.

Light years beyond some faded washes or artfully placed tears, the traditional manufacturing techniques, fabrics, tools, all the way down to the indigo hand-dyeing of denim, utilized by Dr. Collectors embody the heart and soul of what makes vintage appealing. These are clothes that are meant to last.

6590350131274.title: WORDMARK CAP
6590350131274.body_html:
Los Angeles based Mister Green was formed in response to the shifting cultural attitudes towards cannabis and its users. With public acceptance and legality at an all time high, and growing, the opportunity for a stylistic evolution presented itself. The sophisticated, chic, minimalist style of Mister Green offers a way to incorporate the lighthearted, irreverent, countercultural spirit into a cultivated, contemporary fashion aesthetic.

A lifestyle brand, in every sense of the word, Mister Green’s paraphernalia and apparel are standard bearers for the idea that cannabis is a natural part of everyday life, and not something to stash away.

Mister Green caps feature a lighter-weight, hemp canvas with classic green under bill, and snapback enclosure, as well as front and back embroidery.

6590350164042.title: RBM BUCKET HAT
6590350164042.body_html:
What began as a two-man design operation to create bootleg t-shirts for bands that lacked merch has, in time, grown into an LA creative collective, occasional small-run record label and graphic heavy streetwear brand. Born from the minds and talents of ex-Stussy Art Director, Adam Weissman and artist Noah Butkis, Real Bad Man maintains a focus on music, but have gone on to employ retro graphics, aged pop culture references and shady cartoonish characters for their own humorous and subversive brand of apocalyptic counter-culture.

The bucket hat can be a polarizing accessory. In Bulgaria it’s even known as “idiot ka” or “idiot hat.” And of course, sometimes it reminds us of that guitarist who wears a KFC bucket on his head… that’s just not right. Yet despite its many critics, the bucket hat has gone on to survive every generation since its inception.

6588814753866.title: CHECKERED LOGO 5 PANEL CAP
6588814753866.body_html:
New York has undergone countless image changes over the years, the starting point of the American Dream, the last stop on the way to the apocalypse, the world capital of culture, but one thing has stayed constant no matter what the city's public persona happened to be at any given moment. New York is a place where people from all over the globe are drawn to, to "make it" in their chosen field of endeavor. This the source of the indefinable "energy" attributed to life in the city.

Awake NY draws on the constant evolution of the New York cultural landscape that the city's unique mix of peoples and perspectives. The assurance of familiar quality that comes with a red and white checkered table cloth at a pizza restaurant combines with an eternal openness to new ideas, as the modern streetwear sensibility that creator Angelo Baque honed as Supreme's brand director for ten years is imbibed with the timeless qualities of fashion touchstones like classic menswear and old-school sportswear.

6588814524490.title: ARCH LOGO 6-PANEL CAP
6588814524490.body_html:
Designer/illustrator Eric Elms, known for his work with some heavy-hitting names in contemporary streetwear, has established his own label based in L.A., named for the Brooklyn street that his studio is located on. With Elms’ fondness for creative freedom, Powers Supply comes from authentic and open creativity, as opposed to a strict template throughout the creative process. Elms' signature designs are universal, but the availability of Powers is limited to select locations around the world, making it highly desirable and exclusive in the land of streetwear.

Power's latest collection continues to walk the line of whimsical wit and irreverent humor by taking jabs at the labels and branding of larger entities and offering unique and provocative perspectives through their choice of words and images. If we know Powers, and we do, they're probably still laughing and high-fiving each other on presenting their inside jokes to a larger audience. 

Unstructured, cotton twill, 6-panel deep polo cap. Flat bill. Embroidered. Made in USA.
